JohnSmart: "Every few years a few truly great general interest books on technology, human problems, and social progress come along. Books like 
Carson: Silent Spring, 1962. 
AlvinToffer: Future Shock, 1970.
Piel’s The Acceleration of History, 1972.
EricDrexler: Engines of Creation, 1986.
HansMoravec: Mind Children, 1988.
Hawken: The Ecology of Commerce, 1993.
Stock: Metaman, 1993.
Simon: The State of Humanity, 1996.
DavidBrin: The TransparentSociety, 1998.
RayKurzweil The AgeOfSpiritualMachines, 1999.
Rhodes: VisionsOfTechnology, 1999.
Friedman’s The Lexus and the Olive Tree, 1999.
Wright’s Nonzero, 2000.
Lomborg’s The Skeptical Environmentalist, 2001.
Wallace’s Moral Machines, 2008.
KevinKelly: WhatTechnologyWants, 2010.
StevenPinker: The Better Angels of Our Nature, 2011.
Ridley: The Rational Optimist, 2011.
Now comes PeterDiamandis and Kotler: AbundanceBook, 2012, a member of this very rare and special class."

http://eversmarterworld.wordpress.com/2012/05/26/abundance-2012-why-you-should-read-this-book/
